data.name: Blastoise-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Press
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Minun

abilities.name: Minus Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 2 cards. You can't use more than 1 Minus Charge Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Minun is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Tag Play —
attacks.text: If you have Plusle on your Bench, you may move an Energy card attached to Minun to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Cascoon is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Cascoon and put it onto Cascoon. (This counts as evolving Cascoon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Cascoon is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

data.flavorText: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.

data.name: Totodile
data.flavorText: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flailing Flop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Tail Revenge
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of Magikarp in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Wreak Havoc
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card from your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dragon Beat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card from each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Team Aqua's Electrike.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Rayquaza.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Rayquaza.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Enter the Dragon
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card that evolves from this Pokémon from your discard pile onto this Pokémon to evolve it.

data.flavorText: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but they have become gradually weaker over time.

data.name: Joltik

attacks.name: Night March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Pokémon in your discard pile that have the Night March attack.

data.flavorText: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.

data.name: Simisear

attacks.name: Water Fling
attacks.text: Put 3 Water Energy from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Hand Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

data.name: Honedge

attacks.name: Continuous Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

data.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Headwind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the attack cost of each of the Defending Pokémon's attacks is ColorlessColorless more.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It spreads its beautiful wings wide to frighten its enemies. It can fly at Mach 2 speed.

data.name: Unown [H]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Help]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [H], Unown [E], Unown [L], and Unown [P] on your Bench, you may shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw a new hand of the same number of cards.

data.flavorText: It is believed that the variety of types of this Pokémon were created by evolutionary adaptation, as each possesses a different ability.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Lt. Surge's Raichu in order to use this attack.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Ninetales by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Bellossom

attacks.name: Parallel Gain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blend Pollen
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Vileplume and each Bellossom you have in play. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

data.name: Torchic

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Mamoswine

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Forceful Tackle
attacks.text: You may put up to 9 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

data.flavorText: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.

attacks.name: Energy Recall
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to Flaaffy.

data.name: Frogadier

abilities.name: Gale Shuriken
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

data.name: Giratina

attacks.name: Dragonbreath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

data.name: Ursaring

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailing finds all food buried deep underground.

data.name: Mewtwo LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Mewtwo. Mewtwo LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Psybarrier
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo by your opponent's Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Burn
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to Mewtwo.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: You may reduce all damage done by attacks to Misty's Cloyster by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Any other effects of attacks still happen). This power can't be used if Misty's Cloyster is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Triple Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Raticate

attacks.name: Recruit
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand, choose a Supporter card you find there, and discard it. Then, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Extend Fang
attacks.text: If Raticate has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.

data.name: Sharpedo
data.flavorText: It pursues its prey at speeds of 75 mph and finishes them off with fangs that can crush iron. It is known as the bully of the sea.

data.name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Big Yawn
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Shot in the Dark
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.

data.name: Mawile

attacks.name: Pick Out
attacks.text: Choose 1 face-down Prize card (yours or your opponent's) and put it face up. If that card is a Supporter card, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (That card remains face up for the rest of the game.)

attacks.name: Jaw Bite
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

data.name: Typhlosion

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Typhlosion.

data.flavorText: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.

attacks.name: Double Metal Ball
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Backspin
attacks.text: After your attack, you may discard 1 Energy card attached to Forretress. If you do, switch Forretress with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Mirror Coat
abilities.text: If Xatu is Burned or Poisoned by an opponent's attack (even if Xatu is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now affected by the same Special Conditions (1 if there is only 1).

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psyloop
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each Trainer card your opponent has in play.

data.name: Wartortle

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

data.name: Vanillish

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon's habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

data.name: Woobat

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

data.name: Mamoswine

attacks.name: Frost Stone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 90 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: When the temperature rose at the end of the ice age, most Mamoswine disappeared.

data.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Battle Sense
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other cards.

attacks.name: Royal Blaze
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Leon card in your discard pile.

data.flavorText: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

data.name: Jynx
data.flavorText: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.text: If Fearow has no Energy attached to it, Fearow's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Shot Air
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Combusken

attacks.name: Heat Beak
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.

data.name: Alolan Sandslash

attacks.name: Spike Armor
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon's steel spikes are sheathed in ice. Stabs from these spikes cause deep wounds and severe frostbite as well.

data.name: Zoroark

attacks.name: Punishment
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Pokémon, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Snarl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

data.name: Talonflame

attacks.name: Devastating Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 4 cards.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.

data.name: Darumaka

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

data.name: Weezing

attacks.name: Balloon Bomb
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard 2 cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Thick Liquid
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.

data.name: Seismitoad

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.flavorText: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

attacks.name: Pull Down
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of them and put those cards back into his or her hand.

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

data.name: Blaziken

attacks.name: Spreading Flames
attacks.text: Attach 3 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Heat Blow
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear over buildings.

attacks.name: Rushing Water
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Escort
attacks.text: If you played any Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Espeon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe's next move.

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunderstorm
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, Zapdos does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

data.flavorText: A legendary thunderbird Pokémon whose anger is said to cause storms. Some say it has lived above the clouds for thousands of years.

data.name: Glaceon

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Ice Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.

data.name: Chimecho

attacks.name: Call In
attacks.text: Draw a card. If Chingling is anywhere under Chimecho, draw 2 more cards.

attacks.name: Strange Bell
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, that Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: To knock foes flying, it makes the air shudder with its cries. It converses using seven cries.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Ninetales by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Croconaw

abilities.name: Plunge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may move all Energy from your Active Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with your Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

abilities.name: Delta Transport
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Pelipper is on your Bench, you may switch 1 of your Active Pokémon that has δ on its card with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Turtonator

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Swim
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Water Energy attached to any of his or her Pokémon, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Water Slide
attacks.text: You may move all Energy cards attached to Golduck to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.

data.name: Team Magma's Mightyena

attacks.name: Hostile Fang
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Team Aqua Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is loyal to its master. It will protect its partner to the end, no matter what.

data.name: Flying Pikachu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Flying Pikachu; if tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

data.flavorText: By learning how to fly, Pikachu overcame its weakness to Fighting Pokémon.

abilities.name: Anti-Lightning
abilities.text: You can't attach Lightning Energy cards from your hand to Zapdos.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Zapdos.

attacks.name: Lightning Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on Zapdos.

data.name: Feebas

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

data.flavorText: Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokémon's marvelous vitality has made it a subject of research.

data.name: Elekid
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

abilities.name: Playful Punch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, do 20 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (Apply Weakness and Resistance.) Either way, this ends your turn. This power can't be used if Elekid is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it charges up only a little bit.

abilities.name: Prowl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Ledian from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Metal Star
attacks.text: If Ledian has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, draw 3 cards.

data.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Electricounter
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage times the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken.

data.flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Flapple

abilities.name: Apple Drop
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you placed any damage counters in this way, shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

data.name: Eelektross

attacks.name: Crush and Burn
attacks.text: Discard as many Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Thunder Tempest
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.

abilities.name: Spiny
abilities.text: If Qwilfish is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Qwilfish is Knocked Out), flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: Hippowdon

attacks.name: Vacuum Sand
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fighting Energy card and attach it to Hippowdon.

attacks.name: Sand Impact
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Fighting Energy attached to Hippowdon. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its huge mouth is almost seven feet across. It has enough power to completely crush a car.

data.name: Greninja-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Sharpedo

attacks.name: Strip Bare
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent discards all card from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Sharpedo.

data.flavorText: It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting seawater through its body. It is the bandit of the sea.

data.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

data.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Distilled Blast
attacks.text: Reveal the top 7 cards of your deck. This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Water Energy you find there. Then, shuffle those Energy cards back into your deck and discard the other cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It fires hyper beams in all directions, burning the surrounding area to ash. There are some regions where it's called "the deity of destruction."

data.name: Darmanitan

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Fire Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Its internal fire burns at 2,500º F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

data.name: Galvantula

attacks.name: Cobweb Trip
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with your opponent's Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Electroweb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

data.name: M Blastoise-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Bombard
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Salazzle-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Diabolical Claws
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Prize card you have taken.

attacks.name: Queen's Haze-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tepig
data.flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

attacks.name: Sand Swirl
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), move a Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Sceptile is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Hypno

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

data.name: Greninja-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shuriken Flurry
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Haze Slash
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Shadowy Hunter-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 130 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Snubbull
data.flavorText: It has an active, playful nature. Many women like to frolic with it because of its affectionate ways.

attacks.name: Bonfire
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Blaine's Charmeleon. If you can't discard Energy cards, this attack does nothing. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

data.name: Rockruff

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that's proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Jynx is an Evolved Pokémon, prevent all effects of opponent's attacks, except damage, done to Jynx, and Jynx has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Freeze Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Pure Power
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Torchic
data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Rotom

attacks.name: Electric Mischief
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

data.name: Cascoon

attacks.name: Cocoon Collector
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 4 in any combination of Silcoon and Cascoon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Smoke Bomb
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.flavorText: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!

data.name: Mudsdale

attacks.name: Enhanced Stomp
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: High Horsepower
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Shove
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Seismitoad

attacks.name: Seismic Punch
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Splashing Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: By putting power into its bumps, it creates vibrations and increases the power of its punches.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Unown [W]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Want]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [W], Unown [A], Unown [N], and Unown [T] on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It is believed that the variety of types of this Pokémon were created by evolutionary adaptation, as each possesses a different ability.

data.name: Dark Gyarados

abilities.name: Final Beam
abilities.text: When Dark Gyarados is Knocked Out by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this power does 20 damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Gyarados to the Pokémon that Knocked Out Dark Gyarados. Apply Weakness and Resistance. This power doesn't work if Dark Gyarados is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Normally found only in the deep ocean, it has recently been seen in shallow waters as well.

data.name: Tropical Tidal Wave
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, discard all Trainer and Stadium cards your opponent has in play. If tails, discard all Trainer and Stadium cards you have in play.

data.name: Reshiram

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

data.name: Hippowdon

attacks.name: Vacuum Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sand Eject
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

data.name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Tail Lure
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.

data.name: Starmie

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Core Stream
attacks.text: Choose an Energy type other than Colorless. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon with any Energy cards of that type attached to it. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.flavorText: The center section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

data.name: Cradily

attacks.name: Drain Down
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. If the Defending Pokémon would be Knocked Out by this attack, you may remove all damage counters from Cradily.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It lives in the shallows of warm seas. When the tide goes out, it digs up prey from beaches.

data.name: Jolteon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It accumulates negative ions from the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

data.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Howling Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Prize cards both players have taken.

data.flavorText: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

data.name: Dewott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

data.name: Weavile

abilities.name: Claw Snag
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Weavile from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. Choose a card from your opponent's hand and discard it.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.

abilities.name: Auxiliary Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to Team Aqua's Lanturn. Put 2 damage counters on Team Aqua's Lanturn. This power can't be used if Team Aqua's Lanturn is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Mothim

attacks.name: Silver Wind
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Scales
attacks.text: If Mothim has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by COMBEE.

data.name: Remoraid
data.flavorText: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.

data.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Trick Reveal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have both you and your opponent reveal your hands. This power can't be used if Mr. Mime is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Juggling
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its fingertips emit a peculiar force field that hardens air to create an actual wall.

data.name: Thundurus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Headlock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Voltage Rush
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Riolu

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It's tough enough to run right through the night, and it's also a hard worker, but it's still just a youngster.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Raikou, you must discard an Energy card attached to Raikou. (Attach the Lightning Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Raikou.)

attacks.name: Lightning Sphere
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Raikou. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

data.name: Walrein

attacks.name: Ice Entomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. This Pokémon can't use Ice Entomb during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

attacks.name: Take Out
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't an Evolved Pokémon, that Pokémon is Knocked Out instead of damaged by this attack.

attacks.name: Hurricane Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Machamp.

data.name: M Blastoise-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dread Launcher
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Jynx

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

abilities.name: Rain Dish
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Ludicolo.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Drampa

attacks.name: Amass
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.

data.name: Combusken

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.

data.name: Buizel
data.flavorText: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through the water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.

data.name: Sudowoodo

abilities.name: Mimic
abilities.text: As long as Sudowoodo is your Active Pokémon, it copies all of the Defending Pokémon's attacks, including their costs. This power can't be used if Sudowoodo is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.

data.name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Deluge
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

abilities.name: Prize Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose a card from your hand and put it as a Prize card face up. If you do, choose 1 of your face-down Prize cards without looking and put it into your hand. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition or if all of your Prize cards are face up.

attacks.name: Psychic Option
attacks.text: If Slowking has a Water Energy card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If Slowking has a Psychic Energy card attached to it, discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

data.name: Luxray

attacks.name: Fang Snipe
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Discard a Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey–even those taking shelter behind a wall.

attacks.name: Mega Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Lap Up
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Delta Mind
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If that Pokémon has δ on its card, put 3 damage counters instead.

data.name: Bronzong

abilities.name: Metal Links
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.

data.name: Rhyperior LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Rhyperior. Rhyperior LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Hard Crush
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your deck. This attack does 50 damage for each Energy card you discarded.

attacks.name: Upthrow
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for all Fighting Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

abilities.name: Clear Body
abilities.text: Regice can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Lycanroc

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike.

data.flavorText: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.

abilities.name: Eerie Aura
abilities.text: As long as Hypno is your Active Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on each Pokémon that remains Asleep between turns.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Forretress

abilities.name: Spikes
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, whenever 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon becomes his or her Active Pokémon, Forretress does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working if Forretress is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.

data.name: Flareon

abilities.name: Incandescent Awakening
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Memory Capsule attached, Grass Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.

data.flavorText: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon's body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Vanillite

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.

data.name: Slowbro

attacks.name: Careless Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Walk-Off Homer
attacks.text: If you use this attack when you have only 1 Prize card left, you win this game.

data.flavorText: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.

data.name: Infernape

attacks.name: Mach Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Bravo
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Infernape. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fire Energy you discarded.

data.flavorText: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Graveler.

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.text: Does 80 damage to each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Spinning Horn
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

data.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

data.name: Magmortar

attacks.name: Smoke Bomb
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There are still quite a few factories that rely on the flames provided by Magmortar to process metals.

data.name: Dark Hypno

attacks.name: Bench Manipulation
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a number of coins equal to the number of Pokémon on his or her Bench. This attack does 20 damage times the number of tails. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

data.flavorText: Carries a pendulum with it always. Sometimes appears near less-traveled roads and schools at dusk.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon and if there are any basic Energy cards attached to Ampharos, take 1 of those Energy cards and attach it to 1 of those Pokémon.

data.name: Wailord

attacks.name: Underwater Dive
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 3 damage counters from Wailord.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Wailord. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Wailord, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is the largest of all identified Pokémon. They jump as a pack to herd their prey.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fast Stream
attacks.text: Move 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to the other Defending Pokémon. (Ignore this effect if your opponent has only 1 Defending Pokémon.)

data.name: Team Aqua's Carvanha

attacks.name: Fin Smack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: You can't keep up with its movements underwater, can you? If you get caught in this whirlpool, there'll be no escape.

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it's an important means of transportation over water.

data.name: Oshawott
data.flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

data.name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Creepy Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wind Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: These Pokémon are called the "Signpost for Wandering Spirits." Children holding them sometimes vanish.

data.name: Lucario

abilities.name: Precognitive Aura
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Garchomp in play, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Missile Jab
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: They can detect the species of a living being—and its emotions—from over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.

data.name: Poliwag
data.flavorText: Its slick black skin is thin and damp. A part of its internal organs can be seen through the skin as a spiral pattern.

data.name: Unown

abilities.name: Farewell Letter
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard this Pokémon and all cards attached to it (this does not count as a Knock Out). If you do, draw a card.

data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

data.name: Wailmer
data.flavorText: It loves to startle people. It fills itself up with seawater and plays by bouncing around like a ball.

data.name: Blaziken

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Fire and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Turbo Drive
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear over buildings.

data.name: Unown [X]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [XXXXX]
abilities.text: Whenever 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name uses its Hidden Power attack, flip a coin until you get tails. That attack does 10 more damage for each heads. If you have more than 1 Unown [X] in play, use only 1 [XXXXX] each turn.

data.flavorText: It is believed that the variety of types of this Pokémon were created by evolutionary adaptation, as each possesses a different ability.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Flareon

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Flareon.

data.flavorText: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Pignite
data.flavorText: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.

abilities.name: Echo Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. This power can't be used if Swampert is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Green Breath
abilities.text: When you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Sceptile, remove 2 damage counters from Sceptile.

attacks.name: Leaf Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to Sceptile.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: You can't use this attack unless the Defending Pokémon is Asleep.

data.flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

attacks.name: Aqua Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Team Magma in its name, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Chaos Crush
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Confused, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Drilbur

attacks.name: Hone ClawsScratch
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Seismitoad-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Quaking Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Grenade Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Arbok

attacks.name: Terror Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Fang

data.name: Regigigas LV.X
